result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicole E Klug was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Huber Law/Work Release Notification

[MK] cases #15CF129 and #15CF235 called at 3:51pm. 
Defendant Nicole E Klug in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court discloses that it has been a regular customer at the Blue Moon Steak N' Brew, and through being at the restaurant the Court has come to recognize who the owner is; the owner has waited on the Court at times including during a recent visit to the restaurant.  There has not been any discussion or references to this case. The Court does not feel that it has any bias, and the Court does not feel any need to recuse.  
The parties indicate that they are no asking the Court to recuse itself.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; she submits the Victim Impact Statement and restitution form. 
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.  Ms. Klug makes a statement. 

In Case #15CF129 on both Count #1 and Count #2, the Court sentences Ms. Klug to:
--serve one year in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges;, concurrent with each other; these sentences commence forthwith
--0 days credit for time already served given
--costs and fees are ordered; these are to be entered as a civil judgment 
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment in the amount of $200 in favor of Blue Moon Steak N' Brew and/or Sherrie Bunker. 

In Case #15CF235, the Court sentences Ms. Klug to:
--serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges, consecutive to the sentences in Case #15CF129 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--the costs and fees are ordered; these are to be entered as a civil judgment

The Court determines that Ms. Klug already has DNA on file.  The Court does not order DNA sample provision in these cases. 
Felony firearms/voting prohibition warnings are given.
recess 4:30pm.
Sentencing hearing on September 19, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

On Defendant's 2/26/16 Motion to Withdraw Plea:  
[MK] case #15CF235 called at 10:37am, and then case #15CF129 is also called mid-hearing
Defendant Nicole E Klug in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds that Ms. Klug has not established a fair and just reason for withdrawl of the plea.  The Court schedules the cases for Sentencing.
recess 10:48am.

NEXT:  Sentencing Hearing on both cases on 9/19/16 at 3:15pm (allow 30 minutes)

Cases 15CF129 and 15CF235 called together at 3:33pm 
Defendant Nicole E Klug in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  ADA Brookellen Teuber  appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Motion to Withdraw Plea:
The Court verifies review of Briefs submitted by Counsel

The Court determines that Ms. Klug is entitled to have an evidentiary hearing. 
Counsel indicates that there is no disagreement of the procedural posture and evidentiary standards as recited by the Court

Ms. Nicole Klug--sworn and testifies
--Direct examination by Atty. De La Rosa
--Cross examination by ADA Teuber
-State's Exhibit #1(Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights for Case 15CF129)
-State's Exhibit #2(Criminal Case Settlement for Case 15CF129)
-State's Exhibit #3(Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights for Case 15CF235)
-State's Exhibit #4(Criminal Case Settlement for Case 15CF235)
--State's Exhibit #1, #2, #3, #4 are received by the Court

--re-examination by Atty. De La Rosa 
--re-cross examination by ADA Teuber
--re-examination by Atty. De La Rosa

Arguments given by Counsel
The Court schedules a fact finding and oral decision hearing.
Counsel is to coordinate with the Court's JA for a mutually convenient hearing date, allow 1 1/2hour.
recess: 4:30pm

Cases 15CF129 and 15CF235 called together at 8:41am [mo]
Defendant Nicole E Klug in court with attorney Karl E Huebner.  ADA Theresa A Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

On Atty Huebner's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel:
--Ms. Klug verifies receipt of Motion; does not oppose
--ADA Beck does not oppose motion
--The Court finds that there was NOT any improper advise given to the Defendant
--The Court allows Atty. Huebner to withdraw

The SPD office is to appoint new counsel for Ms. Klug.
The Court directs the State to contact the Court's JA as soon as the State becomes aware of new counsel being appointed, so that new Counsel, State, and Court can hear the Motion to Withdraw plea.
The State is to Contact the Court JA by 3/10/16 to schedule a Motion Hearing, even in the absence of new counsel being appointed
The State is to submit a response to the current motion to withdraw plea by 3/10/16

recess: 8:47am
